title: MD
biography: Eclampsia is the onset of seizures (convulsions) in a pregnant woman with pre-eclampsia. Pre-eclampsia is a hypertensive disorder of pregnancy that presents with three main features: new onset of high blood pressure, large amounts of protein in the urine or other organ dysfunction, and edema. If left untreated, pre-eclampsia can result in long-term consequences for the pregnant woman, namely increased risk of cardiovascular diseases and associated complications. In more severe cases, it may be fatal for both the pregnant woman and the fetus.
aiSummary: Yifru Berhan is a obstetrics specialist with an H-index of 28 at Hawassa University (Member). Has been published in Ethiopian journal of health sciences, Ethiopian Journal of Health Sciences. Based in Unknown, Unknown, Global.
